content: 7th stitch next to your hook - your hook needs to go from the outside to the inside have a look at the hole/space that was created this new little circle is made up of 7 stitches 6 single_crochet and one slip_stitch this is our new round we are going to ignore the slip_stitch in the next row and just work in the 6 single_crochet criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-dinosaur-stegosaurus head d work 6 single_crochet s around 6 stitches you are working around the outside of the head so turn the dinosaur around in a circle as you crochet head e ignoring the slip_stitch continue in the round without joining - *increase in the next stitch single_crochet 1* repeat three times 9 stitches head f single_crochet 9 around 9 stitches head g single_crochet 9 around 9 stitches head h single_crochet 9 around 9 stitches eyes take a few seconds to put the toy down and temporarily shape it so it is sitting flat on its feet use this as a guide for eye placement place the eyes rather wide on each side of the head head i *decrease single_crochet 1* repeat three times 6 stitches close bind off and pull through the outer stitches and close thread the loose end back through to the inside the head but don t pull it very tight you want the nose to poke out in a tapered v shape for stuffing i usually just push the end of the yarn thread back into the head but you can stuff the head very lightly if you prefer spikes notes - for this row you will be working through 4 loops two from each side to close the dinosaur and create the spikes - optional - to assist with joining you can place a few stitch markers through the 4 loops along the back to assist with lining up two sides equally - there are 8 spikes along the back we complete 1 small spike 6 large spikes and 1 small spike - a small spike is a half_double_crochet picot half_double_crochet - a large spike is a half_double_crochet double_crochet picot double_crochet half_double_crochet row 8 1 join the scutes/spikes colour in the stitch right at the base of the neck in the same space as the slip_stitch crochet a small spike - half_double_crochet two chain and slip_stitch in the back bump of the first chain picot made half_double_crochet skip one stitch and slip_stitch in the next stitch row 8 2 now we complete a large spike in the same space as the slip_stitch crochet - half_double_crochet double_crochet two chain and slip_stitch in the back bump of the first chain picot made double_crochet half_double_crochet skip one stitch and slip_stitch in the next stitch row 8 3 repeat the large spike row 8 2 another 3 times across the back stuff stop now with 3 spikes left to complete and stuff the dinosaur it only needs very light stuffing in the body we want the dinosaur to
